TFL book guide Metrum Research Group 2017-02-06 Preface The TFL package is an R package for creating tables, figures, and listings in a reproducible manner. To compile this book you need to install bookdown from Github: devtools::install_github("rstudio/bookdown") Each Rmd file contains a chapter that explains sets of similar funcationalities as specified in the file name. To compile this to PDF, you need to install XeLaTeX. Load into the global enviornment data used in the tutorial data("twoCmt")
2 Figures 2.1 ConcvTime 2.2 ConcvTimeInd 2.3 ConcvTimeMult 2.4 ConcvTimeSum 2.5 GOF 2.6 OBSvIPRED 2.7 QQplot 2.8 barchartMult 2.9 covCat 2.10 covCon 2.11 distMult 2.12 ggpairs 2.13 paramDist

2 Figures 2.1 ConcvTime ## ## CncvTm> data("twoCmt") ## ## CncvTm> ex1=ConcvTime(datFile = twoCmt,ID = '1',ipredVar = 'IPRED') ## ## CncvTm> ex2=ConcvTime(datFile = twoCmt,ID = '1',ipredVar = 'IPRED',minorTicks = T) ## Scale for 'x' is already present. Adding another scale for 'x', which ## will replace the existing scale. ## ## CncvTm> list(ex1,ex2) ## [[1]] ## ## [[2]] 2.2 ConcvTimeInd ## ## CncvTI> data("twoCmt") ## ## CncvTI> twoCmt=twoCmt%>%mutate(DOSE=factor(DOSE)) ## ## CncvTI> ex1=ConcvTimeInd(datFile = twoCmt) ## ## CncvTI> ex2=ConcvTimeInd(datFile = twoCmt,facetBy = 'SEX') ## ## CncvTI> list(ex1,ex2) ## [[1]] ## ## [[2]] 2.3 ConcvTimeMult ## ## CncvTM> data("twoCmt") ## ## CncvTM> twoCmt=twoCmt%>%mutate(DOSE=factor(DOSE)) ## ## CncvTM> ## Not run: ConcvTimeMult(datFile = twoCmt,ipredVar='IPRED') ## CncvTM> ex1=ConcvTimeMult(datFile = twoCmt,ipredVar='IPRED',genAll=F,page=1) ## ## CncvTM> ex2=ConcvTimeMult(datFile = twoCmt,ipredVar='IPRED',genAll=F,page=2,nrow =5,ncol=4) ## ## CncvTM> list(ex1[[1]],ex2[[1]]) ## [[1]] ## [[1]]$pList ## [[1]]$pList$`1` ## ## ## [[1]]$plotCols ## [1] 1 ## ## [[1]]$plotRows ## [1] 1 ## ## ## [[2]] ## [[2]]$pList ## [[2]]$pList$`2` ## ## ## [[2]]$plotCols ## [1] 1 ## ## [[2]]$plotRows ## [1] 1 2.4 ConcvTimeSum ## ## CncvTS> data("twoCmt") ## ## CncvTS> twoCmt=twoCmt%>%mutate_each(funs(factor),DOSE,SEX) ## ## CncvTS> ConcvTimeSum(datFile = manipDat(twoCmt,groupBy = 'SEX',sumThis = T)) 2.5 GOF ## ## GOF> data("twoCmt") ## ## GOF> GOF(twoCmt,cwresBy = 'IRES') 2.6 OBSvIPRED ## ## OBSIPR> data("twoCmt") ## ## OBSIPR> ex1=OBSvIPRED(twoCmt%>%filter(DV>0),xBy='IPRED') ## ## OBSIPR> ex2=OBSvIPRED(twoCmt,xBy='IPRED',xScale = 'identity',markBy = 'SEX') ## ## OBSIPR> list(ex1,ex2) ## [[1]] ## `geom_smooth()` using method = 'gam' ## ## [[2]] ## `geom_smooth()` using method = 'gam' 2.7 QQplot ## ## QQplot> data("twoCmt") ## ## QQplot> ex1=QQplot(twoCmt) ## ## QQplot> ex2=QQplot(twoCmt,markBy = 'SEX') ## ## QQplot> ex3=QQplot(twoCmt,facetBy = 'DOSE') ## ## QQplot> list(ex1,ex2,ex3) ## [[1]] ## ## [[2]] ## ## [[3]] 2.8 barchartMult ## ## brchrM> data("twoCmt") ## ## brchrM> ex1=barchartMult(datFile = twoCmt) ## ## brchrM> ex2=barchartMult(datFile = twoCmt,catList = list(c('SEX','Gender'))) ## ## brchrM> ex3=barchartMult(datFile = twoCmt,nrow=2) ## ## brchrM> list(ex1,ex2,ex3) ## [[1]] ## ## [[2]] ## ## [[3]] 2.9 covCat ## ## covCat> data("twoCmt") ## ## covCat> ex1=covCat(twoCmt,catList = list('SEX'),conList = 'IPRED',nCols=1) ## ## covCat> ex2=covCat(twoCmt,catList = list(list('SEX','Gender'),list('DOSE')),conList = list(list('IPRED'),list('ETA1',expression(eta[1])))) ## ## covCat> list(ex1,ex2) ## [[1]] ## ## [[2]] ## notch went outside hinges. Try setting notch=FALSE. ## notch went outside hinges. Try setting notch=FALSE. 2.10 covCon ## ## covCon> data("twoCmt") ## ## covCon> ex1=covCon(twoCmt,conList_x = 'IPRED',conList_y = 'ETA1',nCol=1) ## ## covCon> ex2=covCon(twoCmt, ## covCon+ conList_x = list( ## covCon+ list('IPRED','Individual Prediction'), ## covCon+ list('IRES','Individual Residual') ## covCon+ ), ## covCon+ conList_y = list( ## covCon+ list('ETA1',expression(eta[1])) ## covCon+ ) ## covCon+ ) ## ## covCon> list(ex1,ex2) ## [[1]] ## ## [[2]] 2.11 distMult ## ## dstMlt> data("twoCmt") ## ## dstMlt> ex1=distMult(twoCmt) ## ## dstMlt> ex2=distMult(twoCmt,order = c("Boxplot","Density","QQ")) ## ## dstMlt> list(ex1,ex2) ## [[1]] ## `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`. 2.12 ggpairs ## ## ggpars> data("twoCmt") ## ## ggpars> ex1=ggpairs(twoCmt,xCols=c('ETA1','ETA2')) ## ## ggpars> ex2=ggpairs(twoCmt,xCols=c('ETA1','ETA2','ETA5')) ## ## ggpars> list(ex1,ex2) ## [[1]] ## ## [[2]] 2.13 paramDist ## ## prmDst> data("twoCmt") ## ## prmDst> ex1=paramDist(twoCmt) ## ## prmDst> ex2=paramDist(twoCmt,xCols=c('ETA1','ETA2'),xLab=c(expression(eta[1]),expression(eta[2]))) ## ## prmDst> list(ex1,ex2) ## [[1]] ## ## [[2]]
